title: DNS Propagation Checker
subtitle: Check DNS record propagation across multiple public DNS resolvers. Compare responses from Cloudflare, Google, Quad9, and OpenDNS to verify consistent DNS propagation worldwide.

googleA.tooltip: Check A record propagation for google.com

githubAAAA.tooltip: Check AAAA record propagation for github.com

gmailMX.tooltip: Check MX record propagation for gmail.com

form.title: Propagation Check Configuration
form.domainTooltip: Enter the domain name to check propagation for
form.recordTypeTooltip: Select the DNS record type to check

whatIsPropagation.title: What is DNS Propagation?
whatIsPropagation.description: DNS propagation refers to the time it takes for DNS changes to spread across the internet. Different resolvers may cache records for different periods, leading to temporary inconsistencies.

factors.title: Factors Affecting Propagation
factors.ttl: TTL Values: Lower TTL means faster propagation
factors.caching: Resolver Caching: Each resolver has its own cache policies
factors.geography: Geographic Location: Physical distance affects update speed
factors.infrastructure: DNS Infrastructure: Authoritative server response time

interpreting.title: Interpreting Results
interpreting.fullyPropagated: Fully Propagated: All resolvers return identical results
interpreting.inconsistent: Inconsistent: Different resolvers return different results
interpreting.error: Error: Resolver failed to respond or returned an error
